intro: Priopetalon pallidum, commonly known as the pale priopetalon, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Priopetalon pallidum is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
